Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class GameScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    GameScreen is a class that controls all in-game sequences
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Benjamin Hartl, Nick Abrahan, Colin Biafore, Bryce Bowers

      Constructor and Description
      GameScreen(java.lang.String player1, java.awt.Color p1c, java.lang.String player2, java.awt.Color p2c, int cc)

      void setUpPlayerKeys()
      assigns keys to player 1 and player 2 player 1 uses ASWD for movement and spacebar to fire, player 2 uses arrow keys for movement and the return key to fire

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameScreen

        public GameScreen(java.lang.String player1,
                  java.awt.Color p1c,
                  java.lang.String player2,
                  java.awt.Color p2c,
                  int cc)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor creates 2 players and loads information given in the play menu and enviroMenu, sets background image
        Parameters:
        player1 - Name of player 1
        p1c - Tank color for player 1
        player2 - Name of player 2
        p2c - Tank color for player 2
        cc - Integer that represents a background image
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public void setUpPlayerKeys()
        assigns keys to player 1 and player 2 player 1 uses ASWD for movement and spacebar to fire, player 2 uses arrow keys for movement and the return key to fire

        loads the background image into the game screen
